original_text:
Monopoly: Utility Trails
Il gioco Monopoli è conosciuto pressoché in tutto il mondo. Commercializzato a partire dagli anni ’30, nei vari decenni si sono susseguite diverse edizioni, alcune speciali legate a partnership come ad esempio la Disney. La mascotte di Monopoli è Rich Uncle Pennybags, un uomo di mezza età che indossa un abito elegante e un cilindro. Il gioco è semplice. C’è un tabellone suddiviso in 40 caselle-terreni che vengono assegnate ai partecipanti e su cui è possibile costruire case e alberghi. Ogni giocatore tira dei dadi e avanza di casella in casella, quando finisce sulla proprietà di un altro partecipante dovrà pagare un importo al proprietario. Non tutte le caselle sono proprietà, ci sono anche le stazioni e due società, quella elettrica e quella idrica. Monopoly: Utility Trails è ispirato proprio a quest’ultime.
La grafica ha uno stile Steampunk, con tubi, rubinetti e lampadine a resistenza. Ai lati della griglia ci sono due contatori, uno per l’elettricità e l’altro per l’acqua.
Sulla destra c’è il tasto per le impostazioni, quello per i giri automatici e lo Start. A sinistra invece c’è una caldaia che serve a indicare le combinazioni vincenti durante un unico Spin.
Caratteristiche della slot
La griglia è molto grande, con 8 rulli e 7 linee. Il sistema di gioco è a cascata, per cui ogni volta che si ha una combinazione vincente i simboli esplodono e scompaiono, lasciando liberi degli slot che verranno riempiti da nuovi simboli adiacenti in orizzontale o in verticale. Si vince con un minimo di 5 simboli e un massimo di 56. La puntata va da 0,20 € a 4 €.
Il ritorno teorico al giocatore (RTP) è pari al 96,61%.
Simboli e funzionalità
Uno degli aspetti che maggiormente ci sono piaciuti di Monopoly: Utility Trails, è il sistema di gioco, che prevede numerosi bonus e funzioni speciali.
I simboli che pagano meno sono le pietre preziose, mentre molto più remunerativi sono il cilindro, la nave, il cane e l’auto.
Abbiamo 4 Wild: Lampadina, rubinetto, carrozza e locomotiva d’oro, tutti con la scritta Wild. Essi sostituiscono tutti i simboli eccetto la lampadina e il rubinetto (dorati e senza la scritta Wild).
Se i simboli Wild non portano ad una vincita, essi rimangono fissi sul tabellone sino alla prima combinazione buona.
Quando a due estremità di un gruppo di simboli compaiono due locomotive dorate, si attiva la funzione Binario e tutti i simboli diventano vagoni.
Con quattro locomotive dorate a formare un quadrato, allora tutti i simboli all’interno si trasformano in vagoni.
Se un Jolly vagone rimane sul tabellone dopo una cascata, allora si trasformerà in Jolly dorato.
Durante gli Spin, può accadere che appaia la carta Probabilità 3×3 a cui è legato un moltiplicatore compreso tra 5x e 1.000x.
Ogni volta che compare il simbolo rubinetto dell’acqua dorato, allora il livello dell’acqua nella colonnina accanto alla griglia salirà di una tacca. Riempiendola, si attiverà la funzione Acqua Potabile: tutti i gruppi vincenti di simboli vengono bloccati sul tabellone e gli altri verranno rimossi. Dai rubinetti sopra la griglia verrà rilasciata acqua che potenzierà i simboli presenti.
Quando compare il simbolo della lampadina, verrà aggiunta una tacca al contatore sulla destra. Al raggiungimento della soglia, si attiverà il gioco Società Elettrica. In questo caso verranno assegnati 3 giri gratuiti durante i quali i simboli saranno sostituiti da carte proprietà, tessere colorate e carte chance che aumenteranno le nostre vincite.
Se si riesce a riempire il tabellone di Jolly, allora si vincerà il Jackpot «Giù dai Binari».

raw_translation.response:
Monopoly: Utility Trails
The Monopoly game is known all over the world. Commercialized since the 1930s, different editions have been released over the decades, some special ones linked to partnerships such as Disney. The Monopoly mascot is Rich Uncle Pennybags, a middle-aged man who wears an elegant suit and top hat. The game is simple. There is a board divided into 40 property squares that are assigned to the participants and on which it is possible to build houses and hotels. Each player throws dice and moves from square to square, when they land on another player's property they must pay an amount to the owner. Not all squares are property, there are also stations and two companies, the electric and the water company. Monopoly: Utility Trails is inspired by the latter.

The graphics have a Steampunk style, with pipes, taps and resistance bulbs. On the sides of the grid there are two counters, one for electricity and the other for water.

On the right there is the button for settings, the one for automatic spins and the Start. On the left there is a boiler that indicates the winning combinations during a single Spin.

Features of the slot
The grid is very large, with 8 reels and 7 lines. The game system is cascading, so every time there is a winning combination the symbols explode and disappear, leaving free slots that will be filled with new adjacent symbols horizontally or vertically. You win with a minimum of 5 symbols and a maximum of 56. The bet ranges from €0.20 to €4.

The theoretical return to player (RTP) is 96.61%.

Symbols and features
One of the aspects that we liked most about Monopoly: Utility Trails is the game system, which provides numerous bonuses and special features.

The symbols that pay the least are gemstones, while much more rewarding are the top hat, ship, dog and car.

We have 4 Wilds: Lightbulb, tap, carriage and golden locomotive, all with the word Wild. They replace all symbols except the gold lightbulb and tap (without the Wild inscription).

If the Wild symbols do not lead to a win, they remain fixed on the board until the first good combination.

When two golden locomotives appear at either end of a group of symbols, the Railroad function is activated and all symbols become wagons.

With four golden locomotives forming a square, all symbols inside are transformed into carriages.

If a Wild carriage remains on the board after a cascade, it will transform into a golden Wild.

During Spins, it may happen that the 3x3 Chance card appears, which is linked to a multiplier ranging from 5x to 1,000x.

Every time the golden water tap symbol appears, the water level in the column next to the grid will rise by one mark. When it is full, the Drinking Water function is activated: all winning symbol groups are locked on the board and the others are removed. Water released from the taps above the grid will enhance the symbols present.

When the light bulb symbol appears, a mark will be added to the counter on the right. Upon reaching the threshold, the Electric Company game is activated. In this case, 3 free spins will be awarded during which symbols will be replaced by property cards, colored tiles, and chance cards that will increase our winnings.

If you manage to fill the board with Wilds, then you will win the "Off the Rails" jackpot.

Review: Monopoly: Utility Trails
The Monopoly game is known all over the world. Commercialized since the 1930s, different editions have been released over the decades, some special ones linked to partnerships such as Disney. The Monopoly mascot is Rich Uncle Pennybags, a middle-aged man who wears an elegant suit and top hat. The game is simple. There is a board divided into 40 property squares that are assigned to the participants and on which it is possible to build houses and hotels. Each player throws dice and moves from square to square, when they land on another player's property they must pay an amount to the owner. Not all squares are property, there are also stations and two companies, the electric and the water company. Monopoly: Utility Trails is inspired by the latter.

The graphics have a Steampunk style, with pipes, taps and resistance bulbs. On the sides of the grid there are two counters, one for electricity and the other for water.

On the right there is the button for settings, the one for automatic spins and the Start. On the left there is a boiler that indicates the winning combinations during a single Spin.

Features of the slot
The grid is very large, with 8 reels and 7 lines. The game system is cascading, so every time there is a winning combination the symbols explode and disappear, leaving free slots that will be filled with new adjacent symbols horizontally or vertically. You win with a minimum of 5 symbols and a maximum of 56. The bet ranges from €0.20 to €4.

The theoretical return to player (RTP) is 96.61%.

Symbols and features
One of the aspects that we liked most about Monopoly: Utility Trails is the game system, which provides numerous bonuses and special features.

The symbols that pay the least are gemstones, while much more rewarding are the top hat, ship, dog and car.

We have 4 Wilds: Lightbulb, tap, carriage and golden locomotive, all with the word Wild. They replace all symbols except the gold lightbulb and tap (without the Wild inscription).

If the Wild symbols do not lead to a win, they remain fixed on the board until the first good combination.

When two golden locomotives appear at either end of a group of symbols, the Railroad function is activated and all symbols become wagons.

With four golden locomotives forming a square, all symbols inside are transformed into carriages.

If a Wild carriage remains on the board after a cascade, it will transform into a golden Wild.

During Spins, it may happen that the 3x3 Chance card appears, which is linked to a multiplier ranging from 5x to 1,000x.

Every time the golden water tap symbol appears, the water level in the column next to the grid will rise by one mark. When it is full, the Drinking Water function is activated: all winning symbol groups are locked on the board and the others are removed. Water released from the taps above the grid will enhance the symbols present.

When the light bulb symbol appears, a mark will be added to the counter on the right. Upon reaching the threshold, the Electric Company game is activated. In this case, 3 free spins will be awarded during which symbols will be replaced by property cards, colored tiles, and chance cards that will increase our winnings.

If you manage to fill the board with Wilds, then you will win the "Off the Rails" jackpot.

Review:
 
Gameplay and Features

Monopoly: Utility Trails is a slot game with an 8-reel, 7-line grid that offers cascading gameplay. Winning combinations disappear and are replaced with new symbols, providing more opportunities to win. The game offers bonus features such as Wild symbols, Railroad function, Drinking Water function, Electric Company game, and a chance card multiplier. The minimum number of symbols for a win is 5, and the maximum is 56. The betting range is between €0.20 and €4, and the theoretical RTP is 96.61%.

Graphics and Design

Monopoly: Utility Trails has a Steampunk style design, with pipes, taps, and bulbs to match the utility theme. The graphics enhance the gameplay experience, and the side counters add an exciting element to the game. The winning combinations are displayed on a boiler on the left while the various settings buttons such as autoplay and start are located on the right-hand side.

Bonuses and Special Features

One of the standout features of Monopoly: Utility Trails is the number of bonuses and special features. The game offers four Wild symbols: lightbulb, tap, carriage, and golden locomotive with the word Wild. When two golden locomotives appear, the Railroad function is activated. When four golden locomotives are arranged as a square, all symbols inside are turned into carriages, and if a Wild carriage appears, it will transform into a golden Wild. There is also a Chance card multiplier that can range from 5x to 1,000x. The Drinking Water function is activated when the golden water tap symbol appears, while the Electric Company game is activated when the light bulb symbol appears. Finally, filling the board with Wilds will trigger the Off the Rails jackpot.

Betting Range and Jackpot

The minimum bet in Monopoly: Utility Trails is €0.20, while the max bet is €4. The game offers an Off the Rails jackpot if the play manages to fill the board with Wilds.

Return to Player (RTP) Percentage

The theoretical return to player (RTP) percentage in Monopoly: Utility Trails is 96.61%, which is among the average rates in the online slot industry.

faq.answer: Monopoly: Utility Trails has 4 Wild symbols: Lightbulb, tap, carriage, and golden locomotive, that replace all symbols except the gold Lightbulb and tap. If a Wild symbol does not lead to a win, it remains fixed on the board until the next winning combination.

faq.question: What happens when two golden locomotives appear at either end of a group of symbols?
faq.answer: When two golden locomotives appear at either end of a group of symbols, the Railroad function is activated, and all symbols become wagons.

faq.question: What happens when four golden locomotives form a square?
faq.answer: When four golden locomotives form a square, all symbols inside are transformed into carriages.

faq.question: What is the 3x3 Chance card?

Review: Monopoly: Utility Trails
The Monopoly game is known all over the world. Commercialized since the 1930s, different editions have been released over the decades, some special ones linked to partnerships such as Disney. The Monopoly mascot is Rich Uncle Pennybags, a middle-aged man who wears an elegant suit and top hat. The game is simple. There is a board divided into 40 property squares that are assigned to the participants and on which it is possible to build houses and hotels. Each player throws dice and moves from square to square, when they land on another player's property they must pay an amount to the owner. Not all squares are property, there are also stations and two companies, the electric and the water company. Monopoly: Utility Trails is inspired by the latter.

The graphics have a Steampunk style, with pipes, taps and resistance bulbs. On the sides of the grid there are two counters, one for electricity and the other for water.

On the right there is the button for settings, the one for automatic spins and the Start. On the left there is a boiler that indicates the winning combinations during a single Spin.

Features of the slot
The grid is very large, with 8 reels and 7 lines. The game system is cascading, so every time there is a winning combination the symbols explode and disappear, leaving free slots that will be filled with new adjacent symbols horizontally or vertically. You win with a minimum of 5 symbols and a maximum of 56. The bet ranges from €0.20 to €4.

The theoretical return to player (RTP) is 96.61%.

Symbols and features
One of the aspects that we liked most about Monopoly: Utility Trails is the game system, which provides numerous bonuses and special features.

The symbols that pay the least are gemstones, while much more rewarding are the top hat, ship, dog and car.

We have 4 Wilds: Lightbulb, tap, carriage and golden locomotive, all with the word Wild. They replace all symbols except the gold lightbulb and tap (without the Wild inscription).

If the Wild symbols do not lead to a win, they remain fixed on the board until the first good combination.

When two golden locomotives appear at either end of a group of symbols, the Railroad function is activated and all symbols become wagons.

With four golden locomotives forming a square, all symbols inside are transformed into carriages.

If a Wild carriage remains on the board after a cascade, it will transform into a golden Wild.

During Spins, it may happen that the 3x3 Chance card appears, which is linked to a multiplier ranging from 5x to 1,000x.

Every time the golden water tap symbol appears, the water level in the column next to the grid will rise by one mark. When it is full, the Drinking Water function is activated: all winning symbol groups are locked on the board and the others are removed. Water released from the taps above the grid will enhance the symbols present.

When the light bulb symbol appears, a mark will be added to the counter on the right. Upon reaching the threshold, the Electric Company game is activated. In this case, 3 free spins will be awarded during which symbols will be replaced by property cards, colored tiles, and chance cards that will increase our winnings.

If you manage to fill the board with Wilds, then you will win the "Off the Rails" jackpot.
